contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Akebono'''|曙}} is a [[Japanese language|Japanese]] noun that means "[[dawn]]" or "daybreak". It may also refer to: * [[Akebono (genus)|''Akebono'' (genus)]], a fly genus in the family [[Sciomyzidae]] or Phaeomyiidae * [[Akebono (satellite)]], a geomagnetosphere observation satellite * [[Akebono scale]], a common scale used in Japanese music. * [[Akebono (train)|''Akebono'' (train)]], a sleeping-car train in Japan * [[Akebono Tarō]], a retired sumo wrestler ==Ships== * ''[[Akebono Maru]]'', a Japanese oil tanker and fishing trawler that capsized in 1982 * [[Japanese destroyer Akebono (1930)|Japanese destroyer ''Akebono'' (1930)]], a Fubuki-class destroyer of the Imperial Japanese Navy in World War II * [[JDS Akebono (DE201)|JDS ''Akebono'' (DE201)]], a Japanese frigate that entered into service of the Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force in 1956 {{disambig}}
